column4: Anyone know why Ubuntu will refuse to boot with an IDE Drive connected? Ubuntu is installed on a SATA Hard drive.
I'd be so happy if someone could help me fix it, I just wanna get off windows lol
run it in recovery mode and see what dmesg has to say?
how do I do that?
can you get to a grub boot screen?
oh yes, it loads grub fine - just when it goes to the Ubuntu boot splash it just locks up
ok, there should be an option in grub for recovery mode
ahhhh yes, I know now!
ok :) give it a spin, much easier to debug from there
let me go try that, be back in a min
end_request: I/O error, dev sda, sector 8     Buffer I/O error on device sda, sector 24  - I get a load of them
congradulations, you have a groken drive
run an fsck on it
but Windows can read and write to it perfectly
how would I do that? I get no chance to run any commands, it just tries to load the OS
from the recovery console. also try running fdisk on it and just check to see if its readable
I'm confused, where do I enter the command fsck?
yeah but where is that?
im sorry, i gotta go. its the little root@ubuntu# that pops up when you enter recovery mode
ok tahnks for your help
no. just try to diagnose the drive, then if worst comes to worse, disable it at boot with the "blacklist"
